title: Castello d'Albola 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of new leather, menthol and dark culinary spice lift out of the glass. The linear, refined palate offers red cherry, clove and a hint of licorice framed in fine-grained, polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Domaine de Colonat 2016 Clos Reisser  (Brouilly)
description: Bernard and Thomas Collonge have produced a rich and smooth wine from this three-acre vineyard. It shows the round texture typical of the appellation although with the addition of some fine tannins. The ripe berry fruits are well balanced with the structure. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Grand Garant 2016 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)
description: Named after the location of the domaine's winery, this wine is richly structured and full of spice as well as fruit flavors. Dense and concentrated with black-cherry fruit, it has a firm, dry core that will soften. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Domaine des Sénéchaux 2013 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Whiffs of violets, freshly tilled earth and strawberries abound on the nose. This is a fleshy, voluptuous wine but vibrant black-cherry and berry flavors keep the palate fresh. Fine, ripe tannins accentuate a soft, delicate finish.

title: Château Gaillard 2016  Beaujolais-Villages
description: Made from 65-year-old vines in a five-acre parcel, this wine is rich with black fruits and crisp acidity. With its structure and dense texture, this wine needs to age for a few months. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Les Charmes Cuvée Nature  (Morgon)
description: This structured wine is firm and has an intense mineral texture. Rich black-cherry fruits are balanced with intense youthful acidity that needs to soften. This fruity, structured wine is one to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Enkidu 2014 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Seductive in black raspberry, this wine has sizable walls of tannin to burst through and is hugely concentrated in cherry cola and an herbaceous streak. Interlaced acidity saves the day and keeps it relatively fresh in the glass.

title: Garage Wine Co. 2015 The Soothsayers Ferment Cinsault (Chile)
description: Cinsault is emerging as a serious player in Chile after decades of neglect, with wines like Soothsayers Ferment helping the category. A fresh fruity nose is backed by a grabby palate that deals saucy plum and wild berry flavors. A drawing rubbery finish tastes savory and roasted.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Pluto's Fury Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Forested tree pine, soy and cardamom greet the nose in this intriguing, inviting wine, which is brooding in baked cherry and concentrated strawberry flavors. Velvety and luscious, it's made in a fuller, lusher style that works within its balance of supportive acidity.

title: Graziano 2013 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: This is an unusually drinkable Petite Sirah, considering the varietal's reputation for massive tannins. It has lots of jammy fruit flavors, firm but not drying tannins, and a sense of richness that counters the tannin for a soothing mouthfeel.

title: Hannes Reeh 2016 Rohstoff Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: Hazelnut and lemon appear in complete synthesis on the nose and palate of this wine. The body reveals more fleshy, lemon-tinged pear fruit and relies on its leesy, nutty and slightly toasty background for structure and texture. This is a big wine that manages to remain toned and fresh.

title: Henry Fessy 2016  Chénas
description: Chénas, the small appellation next to Moulin-à-Vent, shares something of the same structure. Coming from steep hillside slopes, this wine has a mineral character as well as solid tannins. Its black fruits are still developing, so drink this wine from mid-2018.

title: Höpler 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Very bright, fresh and youthful fruit flashes invitingly in the glass. A second sniff reveals how juicy the black and red cherry notes are. The palate presents this even more clearly: abundant, ripe but balanced fruit brims and plays. Tannins remain in the background while freshness corrals the fruit. This is smoth, fresh and entirely fruit-driven.

title: Höpler 2016 Kirchberg Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: The nose of this wine gives an immediate breezy, zesty impression before a faint hazelnut note appears. On the palate, fruit is in the foregound. Green apple plays with ripe yellow pear and leaves a lovely, light-footed yet textured mouthfeel with a refreshing finish.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Baked leather rides over flavors of black licorice and pepper in this perfumed, older vine wine. Gritty in texture, it's full bodied and densely packed in tannin, with a streak of acidity that keeps it fresh in underlying strawberry and cherry cola.

title: I Sodi 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Made with 93% Sangiovese and 7% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and a whiff of cooking spice. The bright palate offers black raspberry, red cherry and star anise alongside snug tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Château de Bellevue  (Fleurie)
description: This wine has a firm structure as well as ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins are contained within a floral, rich wine that is still developing. Drink this potentially delicious wine from late 2018.

title: Jeff Gordon 2012 Joie de Vivre Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 47% Syrah, 40% Petite Sirah and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon, the nose on this wine at first is shy, but slowly warms to reveal complementary flavors of spicy cedar, pencil shavings, sage and herb. Fully ripe, rich and rewarding in red currant, it has a meaty undertow of varietal character.

title: Karine 2013 Laurie's Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Madera)
description: This is a tasty dry wine with effusive flower and honey aromas and mouth-filling mango and banana flavors, all supported by tangy acidity for good balance. It has interesting pairing options, from tapas to shellfish to cheese.

title: Kingston Family 2015 Lucero Syrah (Casablanca Valley)
description: An opaque color and saucy aromas of tomato, plum, herbs and graphite are typical of cool-climate Chilean Syrah. A wide palate is full and generous but also easy to get through. Herbal blackberry, toast and oaky clove flavors finish spicy, peppery and dense, with some unresolved oak.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Cuvée de Nalys Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: A remarkable value for Châteauneuf-du-Pape, this bottling offers ample flavors of sun-kissed black cherry and plum tinged in earth, leather and Mediterranean spice. Savory and supple, it ends with mouthcoating fine-grained tannins.

title: Kohl 2016 Kohloss Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Salty yeast and bruised apples notes create immediate impact on the nose of this wine. The palate brings savoriness and yeasty texture to the fore; its celery salt and miso flavors are bound up with fresh green apple and pear. A big, bold Grüner Veltliner with ample fruit.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with a confectionery hint of marshmallow and caramel before showing its more steely underbelly of fresh, focused acidity. Funky apple, nutmeg and lemongrass figure into the medium-bodied mix, a complement of savory and fruit.

title: Lamole di Lamole 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of exotic spice, French oak and woodland berry meld with whiffs of espresso and menthol on the nose. The dense, full-bodied palate offers dried sage, dried black cherry, coffee and clove framed in tightly-knit, austere tannins. Drink now–2023.

title: Lamole di Lamole 2013 Vigneto di Campolungo Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Truffle, toast, dried mint and plum aromas come together along with a charred note. The taut, chewy palate delivers dried black cherry, cranberry, clove and star anise set against tightly wound, close-grained tannins.

title: Lavau 2015 Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Black plum and cherry flavors are ripe and rich here, but the more rustic, savory tones of game, leather and moss give this wine its flair. It's flush and full on the palate, with firm, upright tannins and lingering hints of dark herb, nuts and spice that linger on the finish. Enjoy now through 2022.

title: Losi Querciavalle 2012 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of ripe blackberry, new leather and a whiff of tilled soil lead the way. The firm, savory palate offers dried sour cherry, tobacco, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

title: Marimar Estate 2016 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This unoaked wine always impresses, offering sweetly floral tones on the nose and a wealth of tropical mango and pineapple on the palate. Steely, with some bristling citrus-driven acidity, it's refreshing and focused, with hints of lemongrass.

title: Meeker 2014 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A rare 100% varietal offering, this works well to showcase dusty, pronounced tannin around a richness of baked cherry and strawberry seasoned in white pepper and orange. Tart acidity works alongside floral aromatics of cherry blossom and violet.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rose, hibiscus and pistachio mark the aromatic profile of this hearty, well-made wine, dipping into juicy, succulent and bright layers of blueberry and black cherry. A round rich tannin structure provides a welcome fleshiness, with a backbone of acidity.
